description: Product of composite numbers between the n-th and (n+1)st primes.
comments: A006530(a(n)) = A052248(n) for n > 1. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 22 2011
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2000
example: a(4) = 8 * 9 * 10 = 720. 7 is the fourth prime and 11 is the fifth prime. a(5) = 12 as 11 and 13 both are primes.
maple: A061214 := proc(n)    local k ;    product(k,k=ithprime(n)+1..ithprime(n+1)-1) ;end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 23 2013
prog: (PARI) { n=0; q=2; forprime (p=3, prime(2001), a=1; for (i=q + 1, p - 1, a*=i); q=p; write("b061214.txt", n++, " ", a) ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 19 2009](PARI) v=primes(100);for(i=1,#v-1,v[i]=prod(j=v[i]+1,v[i+1]-1,j));vecextract(v,"1..-2") \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 27 2012(Haskell)a061214 n = a061214_list !! (n-1)a061214_list = f a000040_list where   f (p:ps'@(p':ps)) = (product [p+1..p'-1]) : f ps'-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 22 2011
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Apr 21 2001
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Apr 24 2001
Better definition from _T. D. Noe_, Jan 21 2008
